frameDefinitions: Partner_1 and Partner_2 or a group of Partners  work together in some Undertaking.
Partner_1 interacts with Partner_2 (also collectively expressible as Partners) to change their social relationship.
The words in this frame have to do with people and the personal Relationships they are or can be a part of.
A Communicator publically communicates some difficult-to-express Content which they (or a social group of which they are a member) have had for some time.
A Protagonist is in the dynamic, maintained state of being alive or has exited this state.
A group of Individuals form a group, the Entourage, which remains co-located with the Attended_person.
frameExamples: CSTR actively <t>collaborates</t> with the Departments of Artificial Intelligence  and Physics.
I <t>befriended</t> the little pony by giving him a piece of apple.
And of course that drippy <t><fex name='Partner_1'>boyfriend</fex></t> of hers backed her up.
Those grievances can be <t>aired</t> during Board meetings. CNI
Just before eleven o'clock, one of the consultants came to do a ward round, followed by his <t><fex name='ent'>entourage</fex></t> of junior doctors and medical students.
listRoleDefinitions: When the parties in a collaboration are expressed separately, this Frame Element marks constituents that express the one that is grammatically more prominent, i.e., the one that is the subject of an active clause.
This Frame element marks constituents expressing the grammatically  less prominent, typically oblique, party in a collaboration.
This frame element marks constituents that express the project in which the <fen>Partners</fen> are collaborating.
This frame element marks expressions that express the parties that work together in an <fen>Undertaking</fen>.
This role identifies the time when the <fen>Partners</fen> are engaged in their collaboration.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the collaboration occurs.
The individual who comes to form a relationship with Partner_2.
The individual whose relationship with <fen>Partner_1</fen> changes.
The individuals whose relationship is changing.
The time when the relationship changes.
Where the relationship is formed.
That partner in the <fen>Relationship</fen> who is realized as the subject of verbs in active form sentences, or of adjectives in predicative uses.
That partner in the <fen>Relationship</fen> who is not expressed as the external argument.
The joint construal of both <fen>Partners</fen> in the <fen>Relationship</fen>.
The <fen>Communicator</fen> is the person who expresses the <fen>Content</fen> (whether spoken or written).
The attitude or feeling that the <fen>Communicator</fen> had not previously expressed.
<fen>Medium</fen> is the observable action or product of the <fen>Communicator</fen>.
The time when the <fen>Content</fen> is communicated.
The role specifies the place where the communication takes place.
<fen>Protagonist</fen> identifies the being or entity that is  dead or alive.
This role identifies the <fen>Figure</fen> or form being described by the target.
The time in which the <fen>Protagonist</fen> is dead or alive.
This role identifies the people or things that form  the <fen>Entourage</fen>.
This role identifies the collection of entities that follow the Attended.
The <fen>Attended_person</fen> is followed by the <fen>Entourage</fen>.
listRoleExamples: <fex>Smithers</fex> collaborated with Chief Wiggum
Britain is collaborating <fex>with France and West Germany</fex> in the development of anti-tank missiles
The two artists collaborated <fex>on a mosaic</fex>.
<fex>Smithers and Chief Wiggum</fex> collaborated well
<fex>Last year</fex> some of my colleagues collaborated in the design of a theme-park.
<fex>In New Braunfels</fex> Paul and John collaborated in the design of a new Guggenheim
She married Stephen <fex>last summer</fex>.
We married <fex>in a gazebo</fex>.
<fex>John</fex> is married to Sue.
John is <fex>Sue's</fex> husband.
<fex>John and Sue</fex> are married.
<fex>Reagan</fex> gave voice to the innate patriotism of the American people.
Members aired <fex>their grievances</fex> and resented the way higher education was being dealt with.
I do not especially espouse the ideas articulated by Diana Plesa <fex>in her article</fex>.
Sometimes, children may <fex>later</fex> put into words a memory from early life, but not customarily.
John Ryan voiced concerns <fex>in Parliament</fex> about the suggestion that somehow the inquiry was not independent.
<fex>Frank</fex> was dead.
Frank's dead <fex>body</fex> was apalling.
Just before eleven o'clock, one of the consultants came to do a ward round, followed by his entourage <fex>of junior doctors and medical students</fex>.
Most of the large <fex><t>entourage</t></fex> the president had brought with him quietly left him.
<fex>The lord's</fex> train consisted of several dozen servants, cooks, and other attendants.
